Description: Rim sherd of Chian, probably Mature Animal Style, pottery chalice; white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus in added white outline with added red centre; exterior: painted decoration consisting of foreparts of goat, to left, with elaborate rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: According to Lemos, the sherd is of the Wild Goat Style. Whilst some of the exterior decoration (specifically the goat) is consistent with the Wild Goat Style, the interior decoration matches the later Mature Animal Style. Therefore, the sherd may be late in the Wild Goat Style and mark the transition to the Mature Animal Style.
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 251, no. 377, pl. 54)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0394) (phase 2)
